trustfund:
TF094602-DEVELOPMENT OF PADMA BRIDGE AND
            SOUTH WEST REGION

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Padma Multipurpose
            Bridge Project for Bangladesh were as follows: outcomes were
            not applicable, risk to development outcome was not
            applicable, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was unsatisfactory. The project was designed to
            connect the isolated southwestern region with the rest of
            the country, as well as reduce travel times countrywide and
            connect the country's two seaports. The Bank
            investigated allegations of corruption and provided evidence
            to the Government of Bangladesh (GoB), which referred these
            to the Anti-Corruption Commission of Bangladesh (ACC). The
            Bank reached an agreement with the GoB on the appointment by
            the Bank of an external expert panel to assess the adequacy
            of the Government's investigation of the allegations.
            Following completion of the Panel's report, the GoB
            informed the Bank on January 31, 2013 that it was
            withdrawing its request for World Bank financing for the
            Padma bridge project.
